text: the destruction here in a pari is pretty
bad as you can see we've been speaking
to a local community chief he told me
that around 750 buildings have been
affected here we were here a couple of
days ago unfortunately there's been a
blackout here with communications so we
only managed to get here today to find
out what happened to this community when
we were here a few days ago we spoke to
one man who said that he was going to
watch the waves and pray to God to hope
that his building would be okay now we
revisited him today and we saw that his
home had been flattened in good news the
seawall that was built here in the last
year has remained intact and they say
that that stopped the sea from crashing
into this town they say all the damage
was caused by high winds now today
philippine president rodrigo duterte
is flying over this region to assess the
damage were yet to find out what
happened in some remote parts of this
country along the coastline and in the
mountains and until we know those
details we won't know the full extent of
the damage caused by this storm
